page.title: 06The National Trust.
page.content: Originally,most of the land in the Slindon sector of our area belonged to a Colonel Leslie, but for the past 33 years The National Trust have owned it.They lease most of the land out to tenant farmers who use it for growing crops and supporting livestock, or they use it themselves for tree plantations and for conservation. Some of the trees which they plant are Beech and Corsican Pine. The Corsican Pine is sometimes planted and then moved,as happened with some which they planted in 1952 then moved in 1956 and replanted at Courthill Pond. The National Trust also ensure that their tenants care for the trees and wildlife on their land, and that the wildlife in those areas is protected.
